channel.title: Powershell Script on
channel.description: Recent content in Powershell Script on

item.title: PowerShell: AzureAD Dynamic Groups
item.description: A few code snippets for Azure AD dynamic groups. One for creating standard groups for your environment. Another for finding duplicates.

item.title: Cloud PBX: Polycom VVX Master Directory
item.description: Reverse number lookup in Skype for Business online (cloud PBX) doesn’t give you much control. If you are deploying Polycom VVX phones you can get around this with a directory file.

item.title: PowerShell: Inheriting Parameters (Proxy Functions)
item.description: If you want one function to have all the parameters of another function here is one method you could use.

item.title: PowerShell: Easy Module Authoring with ModuleBuild
item.description: I’ve previously discussed using the excellent plaster module for creating new modules among other things. Now I’ve integrated plaster into my PSModuleBuild project, turned the whole thing into a module, and changed the name to just ‘ModuleBuild’

item.title: Powershell: Creating Plaster Manifest Files
item.description: I’ve kicked the tires on a great PowerShell code scaffolding tool called ‘Plaster’. Here is my take on this nifty module.

item.title: PowerShell: PowerShellGet Helper Functions
item.description: With the PowerShell Gallery at your fingertips in PowerShell v5 you are able to find and install modules and scripts quickly. Here are a few helper functions you may want to add to your profile to help automate some of these tasks.

item.title: Powershell: PSCloudflare Module
item.description: A well documented API without a PowerShell Module is like an itch begging to be scratched.

item.title: Powershell: New-ADPasswordReminder
item.description: A single, self-extracting, self-scheduling, AD password change notice PowerShell script.

item.title: OSS PowerShell: Platform Independent Functions
item.description: Just the other day Microsoft released PowerShell as open source with builds available for Windows, Mac OSX, and a few flavors of Linux. I’m pretty certain the entire community is super hyped at the news. I know I am!

item.title: PowerShell: New Project – PSModuleBuild
item.description: I’ve spent a little bit of time thinking about and putting together a proper build script for one of my projects. This post covers the decisions I made and technologies I used to get this set this up.

item.title: Powershell: Make Pretty Scripts..With Scripts
item.description: I released a new module for standardizing and beautifying your PowerShell code. Aside from code indentation it also can reduce line length, replace here-strings, and a whole lot more.

item.title: PowerShell: Comment Based Help Generation
item.description: Here is a quick couple of functions I put together which will use AST to pull all the functions, their parameters, and associated parameter attributes and create a template comment based help from the results.

item.title: PowerShell: ASTExplorer
item.description: So I’ve been working with PowerShell and abstract syntax trees as of late. Here is a tool I wish I had at my disposal when i started with all this. It takes your script, loads all the AST elements into a treeview, lists properties as each AST element is selected in the treeview, and highlights the portion of the script the element represents.

item.title: Lync Client: Automatic Fortune Cookie Utility
item.description: Here’s a just for fun powershell script for the Lync user. In the not so old days of Unix administration it was not too uncommon to have a ‘fortune cookie’ display when logging into a system. I’ve always thought that it would be neat to have something similar in the Lync client that would allow for an easy rotation of your personal note field. Little did I realize how easy it would be to add such functionality myself with some powershell and the Lync SDK!

item.title: Powershell: Get-iQuote
item.description: While scratching an itch I found a cool little site that has a simple to use REST api for returning random quotes from multiple categories. Here is a small function which utilizes this online source to pull quotes from the web!

item.title: Lync: Voice Route Diagram Creation Script
item.description: Lync voice routing boils down to three basic components working in concert to decide call flow. It seems quite simple on paper, you assign voice policies which determine call routes based on PSTN usages (often called the ‘glue’). After looking at Lync voice routing way too many times I finally caved into producing a script to create diagrams of the things over the Thanksgiving holiday weekend.
